tasks.task: The farm uses cover crops, like peas and oats in the spring and rye and hairy vetch in the fall. Spading the cover crops with a spader. So MAINTASK would be operating a spader and implementing cover crops. Then subtasks: using the tractor for spading (subtask), timing when to spade the cover crops for maximum biomass (subtask). They mentioned spading in mid-April for the rye and vetch. Also, harvesting the peas early for income (subtask) like four to six weeks after planting. So that's a separate task.

Cover crops also fix nitrogen, which is part of their green manure strategy (MAINTASK). So sowing the legume cover crops in spring (subtask) and fall (subtask). They sow peas and oats in spring, then rye and vetch in late summer. Managing the growth stage of the cover crops before mowing—so the vetch starts flowering or rye is in pollen stage (subtask). That's another timing aspect.
